DOC.brief_summary: This is clinical feasibility study on the device performance with paediatric patients. The main objective is to validate the performance of investigational device in distinguishing and identifying the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) inside the subarachnoid space during a lumbar puncture on paediatric patients.
DOC.brief_title: Identification of Cerebrospinal Fluid With Injeq IQ-Needle During Paediatric Lumbar Puncture
DOC.criteria: Children whose diagnosis or treatment plan requires lumbar puncture to acquire a CSF sample. Consent from the parents Being a high risk patient (as determined by the investigator) Any contraindication to a common lumbar puncture apply also in the investigation
